title: TikTok cuts jobs as tech layoffs continue to mount
description: The wildly popular video-sharing app is the latest technology firm to reduce staff in response to what executives say are ongoing business challenges.

title: Dexter Scott King, son of the Rev. Martin Luther King Jr., has died of cancer at 62
description: The third of four King children, the 62-year-old died from prostate cancer at his home in Malibu, Calif., according to the King Center, where he served as chairman.

title: New Hampshire is investigating a robocall that was made to sound like Biden
description: The New Hampshire attorney general is investigating recorded calls that appear to use a voice crafted to sound like President Biden to tell voters not to cast their ballot in the state's primary.

title: Following in her mom's footsteps, a doctor fights to make medicine more inclusive
description: Dr. Uché Blackstock says that the 2023 SCOTUS ruling against affirmative action will have a long-term, negative impact on both Black doctors and patients. Her book is Legacy.

title: 10 questions about the New Hampshire primary, including, 'Can anyone beat Trump?'
description: The state could be the last stand for Republicans who don't want Donald Trump to be their nominee again. There likely won't be another opportunity with such a moderate Republican electorate.

title: If you donate DNA, what should scientists give in return? A 'pathbreaking' new model
description: That's how a prominent medical ethicist describes a researcher's innovative plan to share study results with participants in Kenya.

title: New Hampshire may be Nikki Haley's last chance to keep presidential hopes alive
description: Haley is the only major candidate left facing former President Donald Trump. Even though she has her best polling numbers in N.H., which votes Tuesday, the rest of the calendar is an uphill battle.

title: Proposed federal law would put limits on use of $50 billion in opioid settlements
description: Lawmakers want to ensure the funds are actually used to fight the addiction crisis, not "as a piggy bank for other projects."

title: Why Vice President Harris is going to Wisconsin today to talk about abortion
description: The vice president is hitting the road to talk about reproductive freedom, an issue Democrats want to highlight in the 2024 election. Her first stop marks the 51st anniversary of Roe v Wade.

title: Landslide in mountainous southwestern China buries dozens of people
description: The disaster struck in the early morning in the village of Liangshui in the northeastern part of Yunnan province. Rescue efforts were underway to find victims buried in houses, officials said.

title: 2 Navy SEALs who went missing off Somalia's coast are dead, the U.S. military says
description: After a 10-day search, the SEALs have not been found and their status is now deceased, U.S. Central Command said. They went missing during a U.S. operation to seize weapons headed for the Houthis.

title: Tara VanDerveer is now the winningest coach in college basketball history
description: VanDerveer, in her 38th season as Stanford coach, passed Duke's Coach K's record. She's helped the women's sport come a long way since she started her college basketball career over 50 years ago.
